intro: Mitranthes widgreniana, commonly known as the Narrowleaf False Pennyroyal, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
